snippet: A campaign of kidnappings against the Hazara ethnic group intensified on Saturday as gunmen stopped a number of buses along Afghanistan’s main highway and separated out the Hazara passengers, officials said.
abstract: Mass kidnappings of members of Hazara ethnic group intensify across Afghanistan; government’s inability to stop kidnappings, or return captives to safety, is growing political crisis for tenure of Pres Ashraf Ghani, who has been in office for just over a year.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein reported from Kabul, Afghanistan, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: A campaign of kidnappings against the Hazara ethnic group intensified on Saturday as gunmen stopped a number of buses along Afghanistan’s main highway and separated out the Hazara passengers, officials said.
